title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 26 February 2014 - XWiki

11:40 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
11:42 <vmassol> evalica: ping  
11:42 <evalica> yes  
11:42 <vmassol> be careful that "UI Extension" component means changes in the ui extension module  
11:43 <vmassol> so menu customization will never be a iu extension module change  
11:43 <vmassol> I see you've been chagning several compoentns in jira  
11:43 <evalica> well… I though about it… but I think is important also to mark issues that added extensions points  
11:43 <vmassol> not like this  
11:43 <vmassol> a compoennt has a meaning  
11:43 <vmassol> you're using it wrong  
11:44 <vmassol> if you want to tag stuff it's a different matter  
11:44 <vmassol> component tells us where it's going to be implemented  
11:44 <vmassol> (not the technology it's going to use)  
11:45 <evalica> k - so for the 4 issues you are talking about I will remove the component and add the 'uiextension' tag  
11:45 <evalica> do you think is important to have this tag?  
11:45 <vmassol> no  
11:45 <evalica> :)  
11:45 <vmassol> a commentis enough  
11:46 <evalica> so if someone wants to track somehow what uiextensions have been added and how-when-where… they should…. ?  
11:47 <evalica> k - I'll remove the component if code was not submitted in it - thanls  
11:48 <vmassol> so far we don't track the technology used to implement an issue  
11:48 <vmassol> seems a bit overkill to me  
11:48 <vmassol> evalica: regarding doc of ui extensions we have a place  
11:48 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ExtensionPoint/WebHome  
11:49 <evalica> Regarding 'Available Extension Points' … I've added platform.panels.rightPanels and platform.panels.leftPanels - but I didn't extend the documentation since I don't have yet all the informations on IXs  
11:49 <vmassol> cool thanks, indeed the doc isn't finished  
11:50 <vmassol> an example is important  
11:53 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
11:55 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:59 <mflorea> has quit  
11:59 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
11:59 <vmassol> evalica: what does http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7927?focusedCommentId=79937&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-79937 mean?  
12:00 <vmassol> is was already there AFAIK  
12:00 <vmassol> (I created it)  
12:00 <vmassol> (here: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ExtensionPoint/AddApplicationUIX )  
12:01 <evalica> in this JIRA, the extension point was introduced and used  
12:01 <vmassol> a jira doesn't use an extension point, I don't unerstand  
12:01 <vmassol> what did you add specifically?  
12:02 <evalica> for each extension point you have a "Added in version" — how you determine that?  
12:02 <vmassol> so you didn't add it  
12:02 <vmassol> JV did  
12:02 <vmassol> you said you added it  
12:02 <vmassol> in comment  
12:02 <evalica> yes … the owner of the JIRA  
12:03 <vmassol> let me rephrase  
12:03 <evalica> I said "Added" … not "I added"  
12:03 <vmassol> done  
12:03 <vmassol> better link to doc  
12:04 <evalica> can you edit my comment? that's not very nice JIRA….  
12:04 <evalica> anyway … k  
12:04 <vmassol> check the history  
12:04 <vmassol> so you don't like the wiki principle :)  
12:04 <vmassol> interesting to know  
12:04 <vmassol> ;)  
12:05 <evalica> I don't like the 'Administrative' authority … to have something with my name, but with your words :)  
12:05 <vmassol> I was just trying to help you  
12:05 <vmassol> sorry about that  
12:05 <vmassol> what you wrote didn't make any sens IMO  
12:05 <vmassol> \*sense  
12:06 <vmassol> yes I could have added a new coment  
12:06 <evalica> thanks :) is not about that… anyway, I will make the modifications to be as clear as it can  
12:06 <vmassol> and causing more confusion  
12:06 <vmassol> anyway sorry to have annoyed you  
12:06 <vmassol> that wasn't the goal  
12:06 <vmassol> I'll be careful next time  
12:06 <evalica> Vincent :) I'm just trying to help.. and you sometimes want it to be perfect … and that's ok  
12:06 <evalica> thanks for the help ….  
12:07 <evalica> and yes… I'll try to be more clear

14:10 <mflorea> has quit  
14:27 <gdelhumeau> Guys  
14:27 <gdelhumeau> about http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension-5.4.x/lastBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.extension/ExtensionTest/testSimpleSearch/  
14:28 <gdelhumeau> the error is: the test expect to have 3 results when we search an extension with the keyword "restlet"  
14:28 <gdelhumeau> actually, it returns 5 results  
14:28 <gdelhumeau> which are all provided  
14:28 <gdelhumeau> so maybe someone has added them to the dependencies of some module  
14:28 <gdelhumeau> anyway, I don't think it is a blocker for the release  
14:28 <gdelhumeau> but I am not sure, since tmortagne is not there  
14:29 <gdelhumeau> WDYT, should I start release 5.4.2?  
14:30 <gdelhumeau> Denis, vmassol ?  
14:50 <evalica> has quit

15:41 <vmassol> guys seems we have a regression  
15:41 <vmassol> when you're editing a page  
15:42 <vmassol> and converting to another syntax  
15:42 <vmassol> the wrong text is converted  
15:42 <vmassol> this is a blocker  
15:42 <vmassol> if  
15:42 <vmassol> it reproduces on 5.4.x  
15:42 <vmassol> just tested on master

16:01 <gdelhumeau> <gdelhumeau> [ANN] Starting the release of 5.4.2  
16:03 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: normally we don't update translations for bug fix releases  
16:03 <mflorea> can I make one last commit? :)  
16:03 <vmassol> :)  
16:06 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: if you are sure that it does not break anything ;)  
16:06 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: it shouldn't. I'll double check. Thanks  
16:16 <Denis> has quit  
16:18 <Inge-> it shouldn't <-- famous last words :D  
16:22 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: done, sorry for the delay (again..)  
16:25 <polx> has quit  
16:29 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: ok, thx  
16:45 <xwikiorg\_guest\_9> has joined #xwiki  
16:49 <xwikiorg\_guest\_9> I am trying to setup a private XWiki site for my organization.  I want a different subwiki for each department so they can maintain their own access permissions.  However I am having issues with users who only have access to a subwiki being able to execute the menu code macro.  
16:50 <xwikiorg\_guest\_9> I assume this is a permission issue. So I gave view access to the Macro space.  This did not fix the issue.  
16:50 <xwikiorg\_guest\_9> Any idea where I should look next?  
16:52 <sdumitriu\_[Away]> is now known as <sdumitriu>
